jam.data
Class Gate

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--jam.data.Gate
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Gate
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

A gate, used for data sorting, belongs to a histogram which determines what type of gate it is. There are two types of gates, ONE_DIMENDION and TWO_DIMENSION,

Since:
JDK 1.1
Version:
0.5
Author:
Ken Swartz
See Also:
Serialized Form

public static final int ONE_DIMENSION

Constructor Detail

Gate

public Gate(java.lang.String name,
            Histogram hist)
Constructs a new gate with the given name, and belonging to the given Histogram. Names will be adjusted to 12 characters if they aren't that length already.
Parameters:
name - name of the gate which will be put on the chooser in the display
hist - the Histogram to which the gate will belong.
Method Detail

public static void setGateList(java.util.List inGateList)
Sets the list of gates, used for remote loading of histograms.
Parameters:
inGateList - must contain all histogram objects

public java.lang.String getName()

getType

public int getType()
Returns the type of Gate.
Returns:
either ONE_DIMENSION or TWO_DIMENSION
See Also:
ONE_DIMENSION, TWO_DIMENSION

getHistogram

public Histogram getHistogram()
Returns the Histogram this Gate belongs to.
Returns:
the Histogram this Gate belongs to

getLimits1d

public int[] getLimits1d()
                  throws DataException
Returns the limits for a Gate of type ONE_DIMENSION
Returns:
a 2-element array with the hi- and lo- limits of the gate
Throws:
DataException - thrown if called for wrong type of gate

getLimits2d

public boolean[][] getLimits2d()
                        throws DataException
Returns the limits for the Gate of type TWO_DIMENSION, actually a boolean array to quickly mask when sorting.
Returns:
a 2-d array of boolean's which are true for channels inside the gate
Throws:
DataException - thrown if called for wrong type of gate

getBananaGate

public java.awt.Polygon getBananaGate()
                               throws DataException
Returns the Polygon object corresponding to a 2-d gate.
Returns:
the gate
Throws:
DataException - thrown if called for wrong type of gate

setLimits

public void setLimits(int ll,
                      int ul)
               throws DataException
Sets the limts for a 1-d gate.
Parameters:
ll - lower channel limit
ul - upper channel limit
Throws:
DataException - thrown if called for wrong type of gate

setLimits

public void setLimits(java.util.List gatePoints)
               throws DataException
Sets the limits for a 2-d gate, given a set of coodinates for points.
Parameters:
gatePoints - a Vector of Point objects
Throws:
DataException - thrown if called for wrong type of gate

setLimits

public void setLimits(java.awt.Polygon gatePoly)
               throws DataException
Sets the limits for a 2-d gate, given a Polygon.
Throws:
DataException - thrown if called for wrong type of gate

unsetLimits

public void unsetLimits()
"Removes" the gate's limits, so that it will return false for all calls to inGate().

isDefined

public boolean isDefined()
Returns whether a gate has been set.
Returns:
true if gate is currently set, false if not.

inGate

public boolean inGate(int channel)
               throws DataException
Returns whether channel is inside 1-d gate. If the channel is equal to wither limiting channel or between them, it is inside the gate.
Parameters:
channel - channel of interest to check
Returns:
true if channel is inside gate, false if not.
Throws:
DataException - thrown if called for wrong type of gate

inGate

public boolean inGate(int channelX,
                      int channelY)
               throws DataException
Returns whether channel is inside 2-d gate.
Parameters:
channelX - x-channel of interest
channelY - y-channel of interest
Returns:
true if channel is inside gate, false if not.
Throws:
DataException - thrown if called for wrong type of gate

getArea

public int getArea()
Gets the number of counts in the gate for the histogram which the gate belongs to.
Returns:
sum of counts in gate

getCentroid

public double getCentroid()
Gets the centriod of the counts in the gate for the histogram which the gate belongs to. This method only works for 1d gates, for 2d gates it returns 0
Returns:
centroid the centroid of the counts in gate

size

public int size()
Gets number of individual points in gate. For 1-d, this is always 2. For 2-d banana gates the number is variable. This is part of the class for HistogramIO to be able to write HDF files more efficiently.
Returns:
number of points to define gate

getNumber

public int getNumber()
Returns the number of the histogram this gate belongs to.
Returns:
the number of the associated Histogram

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Gives the name of this gate.
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
its name
